Wireless Attacks.name: Spoofed SSID Cleanup
Wireless Attacks.scenario: Alice, Mira's friend, accidentally connected to a fake Wi-Fi network at the café and got spyware.
dialogue: Mira: "Hey, can you help me? Alice just got some weird pop-ups after using the café Wi-Fi."
Mira: "She thought she was on the real 'CoffeeShopWifi', but something's off. I checked and there are two networks with the same name!"
Mira: "I'm worried one is a fake. Can you help me find out which one is the imposter and shut it down? Alice is counting on us!"
Wireless Attacks.hint: Two APs share the same SSID but different MAC addresses.
Wireless Attacks.task: Locate and disable the spoofed “CoffeeShopWifi” AP, then reconnect only to the legitimate one.

Wireless Attacks.name: Deauth Defense
Wireless Attacks.scenario: Mira's friends keep getting disconnected from Wi-Fi and end up on a suspicious network.
dialogue: Mira: "Ugh, every time we try to connect, we get kicked off and end up on some weird network!"
Mira: "I think someone is forcing us off the real Wi-Fi. It's making everyone nervous."
Mira: "Can you help me figure out how to stop these disconnects? I want my friends to feel safe online."
Wireless Attacks.hint: Deauth attack frames spike in monitor mode.
Wireless Attacks.task: Block deauthentication frames from the rogue AP so clients stay on the safe network.
software: iw dev wlan0 set type managed

Wireless Attacks.name: Secure Handshake Verification
Wireless Attacks.scenario: After cleaning up the network, Mira wants to make sure the Wi-Fi is really safe.
dialogue: Mira: "I want to be sure our Wi-Fi is secure now. A fresh WPA2 handshake will prove the PSK is intact."
Mira: "Can you help me capture and verify a handshake from the real AP?"
Wireless Attacks.hint: Force reauth on the real AP to capture a four-way handshake.
Wireless Attacks.task: Capture and verify a WPA2 handshake from the genuine AP matches the known key.

Wireless Attacks.name: Beacon Integrity Audit
Wireless Attacks.scenario: Phantom networks with odd beacon intervals keep appearing in the café.
dialogue: Mira: "Strange networks keep popping up with weird settings. Wrong beacon intervals can signal a malicious AP."
Mira: "Can you help me scan and blacklist any suspicious APs?"
Wireless Attacks.hint: Compare beacon interval and vendor OUI tags.
Wireless Attacks.task: Scan and blacklist any AP broadcasting abnormal beacon intervals or OUIs.

Wireless Attacks.name: MAC-Whitelist Enforcement
Wireless Attacks.scenario: The MAC ACL reset left the shop open to any device.
dialogue: Mira: "Our whitelist got wiped! Now anyone can join the network. We must restore the whitelist to keep malware out."
Mira: "Can you help me reapply the MAC ACL list and check that only approved devices can connect?"
Wireless Attacks.hint: Retrieve and reapply the AP’s MAC ACL list.
Wireless Attacks.task: Restore the MAC whitelist on the real AP and verify unauthorized MACs cannot connect.

Information Gathering.name: Threat Host Sweep
Information Gathering.scenario: Several PCs report odd outbound traffic after Wi-Fi cleanup.
dialogue: Mira: "Some computers are still acting weird after the Wi-Fi cleanup. I think there might be rogue devices on the network."
Mira: "Can you help me scan the subnet and find any unknown or suspicious hosts?"
Information Gathering.hint: Use ARP or ping sweep across the subnet.
Information Gathering.task: Scan the subnet to enumerate live hosts and identify any unknown or rogue MACs.

Information Gathering.name: Gateway Interface Probe
Information Gathering.scenario: The router admin panel is exposed on a non-standard port.
dialogue: Mira: "I found the router admin panel on a weird port. That could be a backdoor!"
Mira: "Can you help me scan the gateway for open ports and secure any hidden management interfaces?"
Information Gathering.hint: Probe the gateway across high-value ports.
Information Gathering.task: Scan the gateway for open ports to discover and secure hidden management interfaces.

Information Gathering.name: DHCP Rogue Detector
Information Gathering.scenario: One friend got an IP from a malicious DHCP server.
dialogue: Mira: "Someone's assigning bad IPs—time to find that rogue DHCP!"
Mira: "Can you sniff DHCP traffic and help me disable any unauthorized DHCP servers?"
Information Gathering.task: Sniff DHCP traffic to identify and disable any unauthorized DHCP servers.

Information Gathering.name: DNS Poison Audit
Information Gathering.scenario: Billing pages redirect to phishing domains on some PCs.
dialogue: Mira: "Some of my friends are being redirected to fake billing pages. It smells like DNS poisoning!"
Mira: "Can you help me capture DNS traffic and spot any poisoned entries?"
Information Gathering.hint: Filter for DNS packets to suspicious domains.
Information Gathering.task: Capture DNS requests/replies to detect and correct any poisoned entries.

Information Gathering.name: SSID Footprint Map
Information Gathering.scenario: New phantom SSIDs keep popping up around the café.
dialogue: Mira: "There are new SSIDs showing up all the time. I want to map every Wi-Fi SSID in range and flag any suspicious ones."
Mira: "Can you help me scan and log all SSIDs, and spot any clones?"
Information Gathering.hint: Run a continuous SSID/BSSID scan and log results.
Information Gathering.task: Map every Wi-Fi SSID in range and flag duplicates or suspicious clones.

Vulnerability Analysis.name: Automated Portal Scan
Vulnerability Analysis.scenario: After network cleanup, Mira suspects the captive portal has flaws.
dialogue: Mira: "I have a feeling the captive portal still has some bugs. Can you help me scan it for vulnerabilities?"
Mira: "If we find anything, we can patch it before anyone else gets in trouble!"
Vulnerability Analysis.hint: Run a credentialed scan for best coverage.
Vulnerability Analysis.task: Use Nessus to scan the captive-portal server and then patch any critical findings.

Vulnerability Analysis.name: SSL Certificate Audit
Vulnerability Analysis.scenario: Users still see certificate errors on the login page.
dialogue: Mira: "People keep getting warnings about the login page's certificate. That's not good!"
Mira: "Can you check the cert chain and help me fix any expired or self-signed certs?"
Vulnerability Analysis.hint: Inspect the cert chain either in browser dev-tools or via openssl.
Vulnerability Analysis.task: Identify and replace any expired or mis-issued SSL certificates on the portal.

Vulnerability Analysis.name: SQL Injection Discovery
Vulnerability Analysis.scenario: Form submissions sometimes return database errors.
dialogue: Mira: "I saw some weird error messages after submitting a form. Could it be SQL injection?"
Mira: "Can you test the portal for injection points and help me fix them?"
Vulnerability Analysis.hint: Try a ’ OR ’1’=’1’ payload in form parameters.
Vulnerability Analysis.task: Detect SQL-injection points in the portal and apply proper input sanitization.

Vulnerability Analysis.name: HTTP Header Harden
Vulnerability Analysis.scenario: The portal allows clickjacking and insecure redirects.
dialogue: Mira: "I heard the portal is missing some important security headers. That could be risky!"
Mira: "Can you help me check and add the right headers to keep users safe?"
Vulnerability Analysis.hint: Check for X-Frame-Options, CSP, HSTS in responses.
Vulnerability Analysis.task: Verify and add proper HTTP security headers on the portal to prevent framing and enforce HTTPS.

Vulnerability Analysis.name: Default Credential Remediation
Vulnerability Analysis.scenario: An IoT camera on the network still uses admin/admin.
dialogue: Mira: "I found a camera still using the default admin password. That's a big risk!"
Mira: "Can you help me find and fix any devices using factory credentials?"
Vulnerability Analysis.hint: Look up the device’s default admin credentials online.
Vulnerability Analysis.task: Identify any devices using factory credentials and enforce unique strong passwords.

Web Applications.name: Hidden Field Patch
Web Applications.scenario: The fake login form captures extra hidden data.
dialogue: Mira: "I noticed some hidden fields in the login form. That could be used to steal info!"
Mira: "Can you help me find and remove any malicious hidden fields?"
Web Applications.hint: View source to locate <input type=hidden> fields.
Web Applications.task: Identify and remove any malicious hidden form fields, then validate server-side.

Web Applications.name: Client-Side Validation Fix
Web Applications.scenario: Validation bypass lets users submit harmful payloads.
dialogue: Mira: "I think the site only checks input with JavaScript. That's not enough!"
Mira: "Can you help me test and add server-side validation?"
Web Applications.hint: Disable JS to see what unvalidated data is sent.
Web Applications.task: Bypass client-side checks to identify missing server-side validation and implement it.

Web Applications.name: Open-Redirect Lockdown
Web Applications.scenario: Users got phished via an unsafe redirect param.
dialogue: Mira: "Someone used an open redirect to send users to a phishing site!"
Mira: "Can you help me secure the redirect parameters and test for open-redirects?"
Web Applications.hint: Manipulate the redirect URL to point elsewhere.
Web Applications.task: Secure redirect parameters by whitelisting allowed domains and testing for open-redirects.

Web Applications.name: Directory Listing Disable
Web Applications.scenario: Backup files were exposed in a public directory.
dialogue: Mira: "I found backup files in a public folder! Directory browsing is on—lock it down!"
Web Applications.task: Disable directory listings on the web server and remove sensitive backups.

Web Applications.name: Admin Panel Lockdown
Web Applications.scenario: Brute-force unlocked the portal’s admin panel.
dialogue: Mira: "The admin panel was brute-forced! Weak passwords invited Hydra—let’s secure it."
Web Applications.task: Configure rate-limiting and strong passwords on the admin panel to thwart brute-force.

Exploitation Tools.name: HTTP Login Audit
Exploitation Tools.scenario: Default HTTP login allows unauthenticated access.
dialogue: Mira: "If metasploit can log in, so can an attacker—let’s test it."
Mira: "Can you help me audit and secure the HTTP login?"
Exploitation Tools.hint: Use Metasploit’s HTTP login module with known creds.
Exploitation Tools.task: Attempt HTTP login with msf auxiliary module, then disable or secure that endpoint.

Exploitation Tools.name: ARP Spoof Mitigation
dialogue: Mira: "If ettercap can MITM, so can real attackers—patch it."
Mira: "Let's test for ARP spoofing and then secure the network."
Exploitation Tools.hint: Deploy spoof module against gateway & victim.
Exploitation Tools.task: Perform ARP spoof test, then implement dynamic ARP inspection on the switch.

Exploitation Tools.name: Path Traversal Remediation
Exploitation Tools.scenario: A path traversal let us read /etc/passwd.
dialogue: Mira: "Directory traversal must be blocked—sanitise input."
Mira: "Can you help me patch the input checks?"
Exploitation Tools.task: Exploit path traversal vuln, then add input checks to prevent ../ sequences.

Exploitation Tools.name: SearchSploit Validation
Exploitation Tools.scenario: A public exploit matched our CMS version.
dialogue: Mira: "Easy target—patch the vulnerability!"
Mira: "Can you help me find the CVE and apply the patch?"
Exploitation Tools.task: Find relevant CVE via SearchSploit, test exploit, then apply vendor patch.

Exploitation Tools.name: Custom Payload Defense
Exploitation Tools.scenario: A crafted reverse shell succeeded on the portal.
dialogue: Mira: "If msfvenom worked, we need stricter egress rules."
Mira: "Can you help me test and block custom payloads?"
Exploitation Tools.hint: Generate a custom payload with msfvenom.
Exploitation Tools.task: Deliver a msfvenom reverse shell, then enforce egress filtering to block it.

Password Attacks.name: WPA2 Crack Enforcement
Password Attacks.scenario: An attacker cracked the Wi-Fi key using wordlists.
dialogue: Mira: "We must ensure a strong passphrase and rotate it regularly."
Mira: "Can you help me test the Wi-Fi key and set a new one?"
Password Attacks.hint: Use aircrack-ng against the handshake .cap file.
Password Attacks.task: Simulate a WPA2 crack, then set a new 20-character PSK and rotate it.

Password Attacks.name: Basic Auth Audit
Password Attacks.scenario: HTTP basic auth was brute-forced by Hydra.
dialogue: Mira: "That login needs multi-factor or lockouts."
Mira: "Can you help me test and secure the basic auth?"
Password Attacks.hint: Point Hydra at the basic-auth realm.
Password Attacks.task: Test basic-auth with Hydra, then enable account lockout or MFA.

Password Attacks.name: SSH Brute-Force Guard
dialogue: Mira: "Let’s force-lock that SSH port or use keys."
Mira: "Can you help me disable password login and enable key-based auth?"
Password Attacks.task: Simulate SSH brute-force, then disable password login and enable key-based auth.

Password Attacks.name: Hash Cracking Workflow
Password Attacks.scenario: MD5 hashes were trivial to crack offline.
dialogue: Mira: "We need stronger hashing algorithms for storage."
Mira: "Can you help me migrate to a more secure hash?"
Password Attacks.hint: Use John the Ripper on the hash file.
Password Attacks.task: Crack an MD5 hash, then migrate storage to bcrypt or SHA-256 salted.

Password Attacks.name: Rainbow Table Defense
dialogue: Mira: "Salting will render those tables useless."
Mira: "Can you help me implement per-user salts?"
Password Attacks.hint: Generate a small rainbow table locally.
Password Attacks.task: Generate a rainbow table attack, then implement per-user salts in password hashes.

Reverse Engineering.name: Firmware Extraction Audit
Reverse Engineering.scenario: The router’s firmware may contain hidden backdoors.
dialogue: Mira: "Let’s pull the firmware and inspect it."
Mira: "Can you help me extract and analyze the image?"
Reverse Engineering.hint: Use Binwalk to carve out the image.
Reverse Engineering.task: Extract the firmware image, analyze in Ghidra, then verify no backdoors remain.

Reverse Engineering.name: Credential Hunt & Reset
Reverse Engineering.scenario: Hard-coded creds were found in the binary.
dialogue: Mira: "We need to remove those and enforce secure login."
Mira: "Can you help me patch out the credentials and require a reset?"
Reverse Engineering.task: Locate embedded credentials, patch them out, and enforce password reset for devices.

Reverse Engineering.name: Auth Bypass Patch
Reverse Engineering.scenario: A bypass allowed any password to succeed.
dialogue: Mira: "That jump instruction must be fixed."
Mira: "Can you help me patch the firmware and test it?"
Reverse Engineering.hint: Modify the conditional branch around auth.
Reverse Engineering.task: Patch the auth routine to remove bypass, then rebuild and flash firmware.

Reverse Engineering.name: Token Discovery Remediation
Reverse Engineering.scenario: Secret tokens in firmware unlocked debug console.
dialogue: Mira: "Those tokens are too powerful—let’s revoke them."
Mira: "Can you help me find and rotate all embedded tokens?"
Reverse Engineering.hint: Use strings to find embedded URLs or tokens.
Reverse Engineering.task: Identify embedded tokens, revoke or rotate them, and update firmware.

Reverse Engineering.name: Rebuild & Secure Flash
Reverse Engineering.scenario: Our patched firmware must be deployed securely.
dialogue: Mira: "Let’s finalize and sign the firmware before flashing."
Mira: "Can you help me rebuild and securely flash it to devices?"
Reverse Engineering.hint: Use vendor toolchain and sign images.
Reverse Engineering.task: Rebuild the patched firmware with code signing and securely flash it to devices.

Social Engineering.name: Phishing Campaign Audit
dialogue: Mira: "We need to train them and remove that fake page."
Mira: "Can you help me identify and take down the phishing site?"
Social Engineering.hint: Analyze email headers and landing pages.
Social Engineering.task: Identify and take down the phishing site, then run a staff awareness session.

Social Engineering.name: CSRF Defense Implementation
Social Engineering.scenario: CSRF tokens were missing, letting attackers act as victims.
dialogue: Mira: "We must enforce anti-CSRF measures."
Mira: "Can you help me implement and test CSRF tokens?"
Social Engineering.hint: Check for missing or static CSRF tokens.
Social Engineering.task: Implement proper CSRF tokens in forms and validate them server-side.

Social Engineering.name: Voicemail Spoof Detection
dialogue: Mira: "Let’s implement caller-ID verification."
Mira: "Can you help me deploy spoof detection and train the team?"
Social Engineering.hint: Review voicemail headers and caller info.
Social Engineering.task: Deploy VOIP spoof detection and train staff on verification protocols.

Social Engineering.name: BLE Beacon Audit
dialogue: Mira: "We need to scan for unauthorized BLE beacons."
Mira: "Can you help me detect and block rogue beacons?"
Social Engineering.hint: Use hcitool to list beacons in range.
Social Engineering.task: Detect rogue BLE beacons and enforce beacon authentication policies.

Social Engineering.name: USB Drop Mitigation
Social Engineering.scenario: A dropped USB infected multiple PCs.
dialogue: Mira: "We must disable autorun and educate staff."
Mira: "Can you help me set up policies and run a training session?"
Social Engineering.hint: Check Group Policy for autorun settings.
Social Engineering.task: Disable USB autorun on all endpoints and run a user awareness campaign.

Sniffing & Spoofing.name: Guest Traffic Cleanup
Sniffing & Spoofing.scenario: Clear-text credentials leaked on guest VLAN.
dialogue: Mira: "We must secure that network."
Mira: "Can you help me sniff guest traffic and enforce HTTPS?"
Sniffing & Spoofing.hint: Capture HTTP and FTP flows for analysis.
Sniffing & Spoofing.task: Sniff guest traffic, identify leaks, then enforce HTTPS-only and FTP disable.

Sniffing & Spoofing.name: DNS Poison Remediation
dialogue: Mira: "Let’s flush poisoned entries and secure DNS."
Mira: "Can you help me detect and fix DNS poisoning?"
Sniffing & Spoofing.task: Detect DNS poisoning, flush cache, and enforce DNSSEC or secure DNS.

Sniffing & Spoofing.name: ARP Spoof Guard
Sniffing & Spoofing.scenario: An attacker hijacked traffic via ARP spoofing.
dialogue: Mira: "We need dynamic ARP inspection on that switch."
Mira: "Can you help me test and enable ARP defense?"
Sniffing & Spoofing.hint: Identify ARP reply anomalies in captures.
Sniffing & Spoofing.task: Perform ARP spoof test, then enable Dynamic ARP Inspection on network devices.

Sniffing & Spoofing.name: HTTP Injection Defense
Sniffing & Spoofing.scenario: Session cookies were stolen via JS injection.
dialogue: Mira: "We must sanitize proxy injections."
Mira: "Can you help me test for JS injection and add CSP?"
Sniffing & Spoofing.hint: Filter for suspicious JS in HTTP flows.
Sniffing & Spoofing.task: Test JS injection via Bettercap, then implement CSP and input sanitization.

Sniffing & Spoofing.name: DHCP Spoof Block
Sniffing & Spoofing.scenario: Clients got wrong gateway from a rogue DHCP.
dialogue: Mira: "Let’s enforce DHCP snooping."
Mira: "Can you help me simulate a DHCP spoof and secure the switches?"
Sniffing & Spoofing.hint: Detect multiple DHCP offers in captures.
Sniffing & Spoofing.task: Simulate DHCP spoof attack, then configure DHCP snooping on switches.

Post Exploitation.name: Persistent Cronjob Removal
Post Exploitation.scenario: A malicious cronjob was discovered on the portal.
dialogue: Mira: "We must remove that job and secure future entries."
Mira: "Can you help me restrict crontab to admins only?"
Post Exploitation.task: Remove the malicious cron entry, then restrict crontab to admins only.

Post Exploitation.name: Hash Dump Safeguard
Post Exploitation.scenario: Password hashes were staged for cracking.
dialogue: Mira: "We need to enforce hash encryption and access control."
Mira: "Can you help me delete unauthorized dumps and lock down permissions?"
Post Exploitation.task: Delete unauthorized hash dumps and enforce strict file permissions.

Post Exploitation.name: Backdoor Account Cleanup
Post Exploitation.scenario: An unknown admin account exists on the router.
dialogue: Mira: "We must remove that account and audit new ones."
Mira: "Can you help me rotate all admin passwords and monitor accounts?"
Post Exploitation.task: Delete the backdoor user, rotate all admin passwords, and implement account monitoring.

Post Exploitation.name: Log Integrity Restoration
Post Exploitation.scenario: Access logs were wiped after the breach.
dialogue: Mira: "We need reliable logging to detect future attacks."
Mira: "Can you help me restore logs and set up immutable logging?"
Post Exploitation.hint: Truncate then restore from backups if available.
Post Exploitation.task: Restore logs from backups and configure immutable logging policies.

Post Exploitation.name: Covert Exfil Block
Post Exploitation.scenario: Data was exfiltrated over DNS tunnels.
dialogue: Mira: "We must detect and block covert channels."
Mira: "Can you help me monitor for tunneling and set up rate-limits?"
Post Exploitation.hint: Look for unusual DNS query patterns.
Post Exploitation.task: Implement DNS query rate-limits and monitor for tunneling signatures.

Forensics.name: Auth Log Recovery
Forensics.scenario: After the breach, the auth.log file was wiped to hide tampering.
dialogue: Mira: "Without auth logs, I can’t see who logged in during the attack."
Mira: "Can you help me recover deleted log entries and check their integrity?"
Forensics.hint: Use file-recovery tools to undelete log entries from the disk.
Forensics.task: Recover deleted '/var/log/auth.log' entries using extundelete or TestDisk, then validate their integrity.

Forensics.name: Memory Dump Analysis
Forensics.scenario: A memory snapshot taken during the incident may hold evidence of resident malware.
dialogue: Mira: "Volatility will show me any hidden processes still lurking in RAM."
Mira: "Can you help me analyze the memory dump and terminate unauthorized processes?"
Forensics.hint: Load the RAM dump into Volatility and list running processes.
Forensics.task: Analyze a memory dump with Volatility or Rekall to identify and terminate unauthorized processes.

Forensics.name: Browser Cache Inspection
Forensics.scenario: Some users report that credentials reappear even after logout—cached pages may be leaking data.
dialogue: Mira: "The browser cache might still hold stolen credentials—let’s clear and inspect it."
Mira: "Can you help me purge any stored credentials from the cache?"
Forensics.hint: Use a cache-viewer or sqlite3 to extract saved form data from the cache database.
Forensics.task: Inspect and purge browser cache artifacts (e.g., via BrowserHistoryView or sqlite3) to remove any stored credentials.

Forensics.name: ARP Cache Timeline
Forensics.scenario: You need to prove exactly when the rogue AP first appeared on the network.
dialogue: Mira: "ARP cache timestamps will show me the moment the malicious MAC joined."
Mira: "Can you help me extract and correlate ARP cache entries?"
Forensics.hint: Extract timestamped entries from the ARP cache or use system audit logs.
Forensics.task: Extract and timestamp ARP cache entries (e.g., via `arp -a` and parsing) to correlate device connections and isolate the rogue MAC.

Forensics.name: Event Timeline Build
Forensics.scenario: Logs and packet captures are scattered—Mira needs a unified view of the attack.
dialogue: Mira: "A single timeline will reveal the full sequence and help us shore up defenses."
Mira: "Can you help me merge syslog and pcap events into one timeline?"
Forensics.hint: Use Plaso (log2timeline) to merge syslog, pcap, and other artifacts into one timeline.
Forensics.task: Generate a merged timeline of syslog and pcap events using Plaso, then review for intrusion markers and secure any gaps.
